Package com.foreach.across.modules.entity.registry.properties

Interface EntityPropertyValidator

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface EntityPropertyValidator
Specific validator implementation for validating properties in an entity property binding context. This class provides more contextual details about the property value and the context of its owner.
Since:
3.2.0
Author:
Arne Vandamme
See Also:
  • EntityPropertyController
  • EntityPropertiesBinder

  • Method Details

    • validate

      void validate(EntityPropertyBindingContext bindingContext, EntityPropertyValue propertyValue, org.springframework.validation.Errors errors, Object... validationHints)
      Validate an EntityPropertyValue in a specific EntityPropertyBindingContext.
      Parameters:
      bindingContext - of the owner of the property
      propertyValue - property value holder
      errors - object containing all current errors
      validationHints - to apply specific validation only

    • andThen

      default EntityPropertyValidator andThen(@NonNull @NonNull EntityPropertyValidator after)
      Create a new validator that first apply the current validator and then the one passed as argument.
      Parameters:
      after - validator to execute after this one
      Returns:
      new chained validator

    • compose

      default EntityPropertyValidator compose(@NonNull @NonNull EntityPropertyValidator before)
      Create a new validator that first applies the validator passed as argument and then the current one.
      Parameters:
      before - validator to execute before this one
      Returns:
      new composed validator

    • of

      static EntityPropertyValidator of(@NonNull @NonNull org.springframework.validation.Validator validator)
      Adapt a regular Spring Validator into an EntityPropertyValidator. Only the value of the property will be passed to the target validator, any validation hints will be ignored. Validation methods will be directly forwarded to the target, no Validator.supports(Class) will be called.

      By default null values will not be sent to the validator.

      Parameters:
      validator - that should be adapted
      Returns:
      property validator instance
      See Also:
      • of(Validator, boolean)

    • of

      static EntityPropertyValidator of(@NonNull @NonNull org.springframework.validation.Validator validator, boolean validateNulls)
      Adapt a regular Spring Validator into an EntityPropertyValidator. Only the value of the property will be passed to the target validator, any validation hints will be ignored. Validation methods will be directly forwarded to the target, no Validator.supports(Class) will be called.

      The validateNulls argument can be used to pass null values for validation.

      Parameters:
      validator - that should be adapted
      validateNulls - should null values also be sent to the validator
      Returns:
      property validator instance
